poem:
### Digesting the Week

In the paper's fold,  
Bitter fires kindle,  
Bannon's words skimming the Musk,  
like a stone on uncertain water  
Where illness lingers, unseen,  
a mother waits,  
measuring breaths  
like walnuts in the palm—  
life's brief pause,  
suspended  
between the next  
tick.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Digested week: Steve Bannon’s bitter attack on Musk briefly lifts the spirits | Emma Brockes Monday Hi, from the house of norovirus! One child down, one still standing, no community spread as far as we know, although every hour I check myself over and ask: is that nausea I’m feeling, or have I eaten too many walnuts (again)? So far, it’s the walnuts. But we’re still inside the transmission window so there’s time! According to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
